content.description: start at the seam on the left side of the boulder and follow it up using thin small crimps, top out at the old school bolts on top. the bolts look like they are used for climbing the arete on the other side.
content.protection: pad is needed for getting down the face or if you are feeling up to it, stem down the large crack on the back side.
content.location: one of the closest boulders in Steve's Suggestion area

content.description: Sit start, great left hand and right heel hook for start. Shoot up to a nice round slope and work straight up. Its a little inverted which makes it fun.
content.location: 'Steve's Suggestion' area. If you are standing at 'Seam to Seam' just head straight down the hill and right about 20-30 yards. Its near a large boulder pile.

content.description: start on the center vertical seam and work out  left and then back right, tiny crimps, and thin edges make up hands and feet provided by the seam cracks. a sloppy even thinner finish awaits.

Start to the right of Eff'n'A and traverse the crack system (that is about 3/4 up the rock). The crux is getting around the corner as the feet become a little less positive. Hand jam/side pull to the top!
content.protection: You would need 4 pads to pad the whole climb, but somone could follow you with 1 if you don't have 4
content.location: This route is on the backside of the hill at Steve's Suggestion Area. It faces 'A Few Good Moves.'

content.description: Start low and move up horizontal seams. Same finish as 'Reverse Traverse'
content.location: Steves Suggestion area. Backside (south side) of the hill.

content.description: Start with matched hands on either side of where the roof pinches the other large boulder. walk feet up and move up and out across the roof, use a heel hook and mantle up. then its friction to the top. I should add this is a classic for the area, as most of the ratings go for el cariso... they are all rated relative to the area
content.protection: multiple pads, protect the rocks well because all have the potential of doing damage. the angle of the hill and angle of your body will cause an awkward fall.
content.location: Steve's Suggestion, down hill from "Slope A Dope" and that entire boulder pile.

content.description: Side pull for the start, then ladder you way up.
content.location: Backside (south side) of the hill at Steves Suggestion area, faces 'A Few Good Moves'

content.description: Start on the corner of the Warm up Boulder for the Steve's Suggestion area. sit start on low holds and move up staying on the corner. for it to be a v2 finish by using the black inclusions only.
this is a rounded arete with a few really fun moves.
content.protection: for good protection use 3+ pads, but it's not that hard
content.location: Steve's Suggestion, on the back side (north side) of "Seam to Seam"

content.description: Starts low on the slab section on the left side of the rock as you face North. Climb is a good warm up that moves straight up a crack. Juggy crimps to an interesting finish.
content.location: 'Steves Suggestion' area. This climb is on the opposite side of 'A Few Good Moves'
